block.p: MARVIN S. TRAUB, the chairman of Bloomingdale's, received the Gold Medal award from the National Retail Federation on Wednesday in New York, in recognition of his contributions to retailing. He joined Bloomingdale's in 1950.

In his "thank you" speech, Mr. Traub recalled that a year ago he announced to employees that United States retailing units of the parent company, the Campeau Corporation , were filing for bankruptcy. "We have made major progress in establishing our ability to manage our business in difficult economic times," Mr. Traub said in his speech. "We have a goal to be out of Chapter 11 by year-end."
